questions.question: Be sure to get a ..................... electrician for the job.
questions.description: Competent means skillful.

questions.question: Ever since he got a raise, he has been too ........................ to work hard.
questions.description: Complacent means self-satisfied.

questions.question: The young surgeon showed exceptional ..........................
questions.description: Competence means capability or proficiency.

questions.question: A athlete must have a ....................... spirit.
questions.description: Competitive means aggressive or combating.

questions.question: Travel can be an excellent ..................... to one's education.
questions.description: Complement means that which completes.

questions.question: ..................... with the traffic laws is necessary for safe driving.
questions.description: Compliance means conformity.

questions.question: The hostess received glowing ...................... on the dinner.
questions.description: A compliment is an expression of praise.

questions.question: Please give my .................... to your parents.
questions.description: Compliments means regards

questions.question: The captain remained ......................... throughout the raging storm.
questions.description: Composed means poised or calm.

questions.question: The speaker retained his ..................... throughout the heckling.
questions.description: Composure means calmness.

questions.question: The teacher had no ..................... of the boy's problems at home.
questions.description: Comprehension means understanding.

questions.question: The pregnant woman had a ..................... urge for pickles.
questions.description: Compulsive means uncontrollable.

questions.question: I was …………………………… by the news.
questions.description: Affect is a verb effect is a noun.

questions.question: What awful ……………………….. we are having!
questions.description: Whether is a conjunction.

questions.question: I want to know ……………………….. you are interested in my offer or not.
questions.description: Whether is a conjunction used to introduce an yes/no questions.

questions.question: I could not ………………………….. the gravity of the situation.
questions.description: Comprehend means grasp or understand.

questions.question: A good teacher should have a lot of ………………………….
questions.description: Patients are people who need treatment for medical problems.

questions.question: The ……………………………. of a right angle are sixty and thirty degrees.
questions.description: Complement is that which completes.

questions.question: They are still ………………………….. the death of their beloved father.
questions.description: Mourning is the expression of sorrow for someone's death.

questions.question: What are the actual ………………………………. of this decision?
questions.description: Implications are consequences.

questions.question: He is ……………………………… to working hard.
questions.description: Accustomed to means used to.

questions.question: He was ………………………….. for this contribution.
Marathas ………………………… the fort from Mughals.
questions.description: Seized means captured.

questions.question: Should you ………………………….. taking risk?
After finishing his work, he ………………………. down to rest.
questions.description: Lay is the past tense of to lie.

questions.question: As they have no children, they ………………………… an orphan.
questions.description: To adopt a child is to take as one's own.

questions.question: After the operation, the patient was kept in the intensive care unit for close …………………………….
questions.description: Observance is a customary practice.

questions.question: Keep ………………………… otherwise the bird might become frightened.
He was an …………………………. person.
questions.description: Amiable means pleasing or agreeable.

questions.question: It is a …………………………… report.
questions.description: Confidential means intended to be kept private.

questions.question: Now that everyone ………………………….. come, we can start the program.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after everyone.

questions.question: Day and night come ………………………….
The management refused to ……………………………. the demand of the employees.
questions.description: Grand means magnificent.

questions.question: The tallest of the three buildings …………………………… to my grandfather.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular expression the tallest.

questions.question: The company set up a committee to look into the ………………………….. of its employees.
questions.description: A grievance is a complaint.

questions.question: The old house is ………………………….. with spiders and rats.
questions.description: If a place is infested with rats, they are present in large numbers.

questions.question: One who does not consume alcoholic drinks is a …………………..
The meeting was ……………………… due to bad weather.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: The practice of having more than one husband
Performance without preparation
Action involving destruction of private or public property
The action of speaking sacrilegiously against God
Good communication skills are essential to put your ideas ……………………..
questions.description: To put ideas across is to convey them.

questions.question: The union leaders have ………………………. the strike.
questions.description: To call off is to decide that something will not happen.

questions.question: I think he is lying, …………………………..?
questions.description: Negative tags are used after affirmative statements.

questions.question: It snows in winter, …………………………?
Everybody has sanitized their hands, ……………………….?
I couldn’t ……………………….. what he said.
questions.description: To figure out is to understand.

questions.question: How much will it cost to overhaul the motor? Overhaul can be replaced by …………………..
questions.description: Revamp means the same as overhaul.

questions.question: Did you mean to leave the door unlocked or was it an oversight? Oversight can be replaced by ………………………………?
questions.description: Oversight means the same ad heedlessness.

questions.question: The waiter was furious at being given such a paltry tip. Paltry can be replaced by ………………………..
questions.description: Paltry means measly.

questions.question: She pampers her husband like a baby. Pampers can be replaced by ……………………….
questions.description: Pampers means the same as indulges.

questions.question: Pandemonium broke out when the teacher left the room. Pandemonium can be replaced by ………………………….
questions.description: Both words mean chaos.

questions.question: The child led a cloistered life. Here cloistered can be replaced by ………………………..
questions.description: Cloistered and insulated can both mean the same.

questions.question: Certain drugs cause blood to coagulate. Here coagulate can be replaced by ………………………………..
questions.description: Both words mean clot.

questions.question: The retiring chairman received a panegyric from the new chairman. Here panegyric can be replaced by ………………………….
The bedrooms were painted in pastel colors. Pastel can be replaced by …………………………
questions.description: Pastels can mean light or muted.

questions.question: When you ask him a question you get a pedantic answer. Here pedantic can be replaced by ………………………..
He had a penchant for rich desserts. Here penchant can be replaced by ……………………………
Do you know for sure or is it only ………………………….?
questions.description: Conjecture means guess work.

questions.question: There is a vast difference between infatuation and ……………………………… love.
questions.description: Conjugal means married.

questions.question: The couple celebrated their 10th anniversary of ………………………………. love.
questions.description: Either conjugal or connubial can be used here.

questions.question: A ……………………………… worker arrives on time and leaves no mess behind him.
questions.description: Conscientious means responsible, ethical and dutiful.

questions.question: The boy’s ………………………………. would not let him lie.
questions.description: Conscience means moral sense.

questions.question: Were you ………………………………. of his hostility?
questions.description: Conscious means aware.

questions.question: The public must learn to ……………………………… electricity.
questions.description: Conserve means use sparingly.

questions.question: It was very …………………………………. of you to send me a get-well card.
questions.description: Considerate means thoughtful.

questions.question: To their complete ……………………………. the swimmers saw a shark approaching.
questions.description: Consternation means  shock or terror

questions.question: His limp is ………………………………..
questions.description: Either constitutional or congenital can be used here

questions.question: Chicken pox is a ………………………………… disease.
questions.description: Contagious means infectious.

questions.question: The unusually heavy rainfall was an ………………………….. omen for the travelers
questions.description: Ill can mean unfavorable or inauspicious.

questions.question: The saint was painted with a ……………………………. over his head.
questions.description: A halo is a ring of light.

questions.question: Prices were …………………………………. during the sale.
questions.description: To halve is to cut something in half.

questions.question: Only a ………………………………… of people attended the party.
The man ……………………………….. his head in shame.
questions.description: Hung means let droop.

questions.question: They …………………………….. the picture over the mantle.
questions.description: Pictures and curtains are hung.

questions.question: The terrorist was ……………………………. at dawn.
questions.description: People are hanged whereas photos are hung.

questions.question: It rained …………………………… yesterday.
questions.description: The adjective and adverb form of hard is hard.

questions.question: That was ………………………………… the way to greet a friend.
questions.description: Hardly means certainly not or by no means.

questions.question: Don’t make important decisions ………………………….
questions.description: Hastily means quickly.

questions.question: I warned him but he ………………………….. me no heed.
questions.description: Paid is the past participle of pay.

questions.question: …………………………….. people have the most accidents.
questions.description: Heedless means careless.

questions.question: She was given a reception that befits a ……………………………
questions.description: Heroine is the feminine of hero. Heroin is a morphine derivative.

questions.question: Her …………………………….. deeds helped many people.
questions.description: Altruistic means benevolent.

questions.question: He was an ……………………………….. of the University of Missouri.
questions.description: An alumnus is a former male student.

questions.question: Both my parents are ………………………………… of the same school.
questions.description: Alumni is the plural of alumnus. It refers to both male and female students.

questions.question: The …………………………….. of his statement led us to suspect that he was lying.
questions.description: Ambiguity means uncertainty.

questions.question: Indian is an ………………………………….. word because it can mean an American Indian or a native of India.
questions.description: Ambiguous means equivocal or vague.

questions.question: ……………………………….. students make the best grades.
The members of the club voted to …………………………………. the constitution.
questions.description: To amend is to change.

questions.question: Is there any way I can make ………………………… for ruining your party?
questions.description: To make amends is to apologize.

questions.question: The next door neighbors are ……………………………….. people.
questions.description: Amiable means friendly. It is mainly used to describe people.

questions.question: The union and the company reached an ………………………………….. settlement in their contract dispute.
questions.description: Amicable means friendly. It is mainly used to describe actions or gestures.

questions.question: Canada and the United States have lived side by side in ……………………………… for generations.
questions.description: Amity means friendship or goodwill.

questions.question: The young man gave his fiancée an ………………………………… glance.
questions.description: Amorous means loving or enamored.

questions.question: The pirate’s ………………….. led him to cheat his partners out of their share.
questions.description: We need a noun here and greed is a noun.

questions.question: She suffered a …………………………. injury.
questions.description: Injury is a noun and we need an adjective to modify a noun. Grievous is an adjective.

questions.question: His ……………………… insult flabbergasted me.
questions.description: Gratuitous can mean uncalled for or unwarranted.

questions.question: The situation has reached a point of extreme ………………………..
High blood pressure can be a result of ……………………………
questions.description: Gluttony means excessive eating. A glutton is an overeater.

questions.question: What could have been a nasty situation was handled with great …………………………….
questions.description: Finesse means discretion.

questions.question: There was much …………………………. affection in the hug she gave her father.
questions.description: Filial means befitting one’s child.

questions.question: They had a lavish ……………………… at their country house.
questions.description: Fete means grand party.

questions.question: The lawyer made a ………………………. plea for clemency.
questions.description: Fervent means heartfelt.

questions.question: She was a tough minded executive but she never lost her ………………………..
questions.description: Femininity means female quality.

questions.question: Being locked in a candy store was the boy’s idea of ……………………..
questions.description: Felicity means happiness or bliss.

questions.question: It is not ………………………… to make the trip in one day.
questions.description: All of these words mean the same.

questions.question: The speaker’s .......................... voice put me to sleep.
questions.description: Monotonous is an adjective. We need an adjective to modify the noun voice.

questions.question: Two .......................... sharks crossed the bow of the boat.
questions.description: Monstrous is an adjective. We need an adjective to modify the noun sharks.

questions.question: Speaking down to the people was a ............................... mistake.
questions.description: Monumental is an adjective. We need an adjective to modify the noun mistake.

questions.question: Bicycling is good exercise ............................, it does not pollute the air.
questions.description: All of these expressions can be used to add information to what has already been said.

questions.question: It is obvious from his ruthless behavior that he has no ...............................
questions.description: Moral is an adjective. Morality is the noun.

questions.question: The ............................. of the story is that money can’t buy happiness.
questions.description: A moral is a point or lesson.

questions.question: After the defeat, the army’s .................................. was low.
questions.description: Morale is a state of mind in terms of courage or confidence.

questions.question: .............................. everyone enjoyed the party.
questions.description: Most means more than half. Almost does not mean most.

questions.question: I will ............................... over your proposal and let you know.
questions.description: A mule is an ass or half-donkey-half-mare. Mull means ponder.

questions.question: A ............................. of problems delayed the construction project.
questions.description: Multitude means a great number of.

questions.question: He is .............................. on the subject of faith.
questions.description: Mute means silent.

questions.question: Her ................................ was obvious from the way she told everyone her life story.
questions.description: Naivety means innocence.

questions.question: He was ……………………. by the police, but he refused to reveal the secret.
questions.description: To persecute someone is to treat them in a cruel manner.

questions.question: He was ……………………. for defaming his partner.
questions.description: To prosecute somebody is to take legal action against them.

questions.question: He could not ……………………… his son to continue his studies.
questions.description: To persuade someone is to use reasoning to make them do something.

questions.question: The cops …………………….. the criminal and caught him.
questions.description: To pursue someone is to follow them.

questions.question: A ……………………… man will never support a wrong cause.
questions.description: A righteous man never deviates from the path of virtue.

questions.question: The …………………… of Emperor Asoka is considered to be a golden period in the history of India.
questions.description: Reign is the period of rule of a king or queen.

questions.question: ………………………… progress is essential to gain lasting happiness in life.
questions.description: Spiritual means relating to religion or religious belief.

questions.question: The candidates should write down their …………………………. roll numbers.
questions.description: Respective means belonging to each of two or more people or things.

questions.question: The room was filled with the noise of his ……………………..
questions.description: Laughter is the action or sound of laughing.

questions.question: We had a good ………………………. over his silly mistake.
questions.description: A laugh is an act of laughing.

questions.question: His good deeds are …………………………..
questions.description: If something is commendable, it is worthy of praise.

questions.question: English literature is full of ……………………… to Latin and Greek authors.
questions.description: An allusion is an indirect reference to something.

One should be satisfied with one’s …………………

If you follow my advice, you will ……………..

How ………………….. is he?
